alert.note: Alert for Coeur d'Alene Area; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 5:06PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT NORTHWESTERN KOOTENAI COUNTY... At 405 PM PST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from near Hauser to Coeur d`Alene. Movement was south at 5 mph. Locations impacted include... Coeur d`Alene, Post Falls, Hayden, Rathdrum, Dalton Gardens, Hauser, Hayden Lake, Fernan Lake Village, Huetter, State Line and Beauty Creek Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Idaho between mile markers 1 and 22. U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 424 and 440. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this squall. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. A rapid drop in temperatures will lead to the rapid formation of black ice on area roadways. Black ice is nearly impossible to see and roadways may appear wet. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
